item.title: Amber add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Likest thou jelly within thy doughnut?" -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Amber add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Amber add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Amber add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "That which does not kill us makes us stronger." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Amber add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Amber add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Amber add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "He who knows all the answers has not been asked all the questions." -- Confucius

item.title: Amber add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Reality continues to ruin my life." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Amber add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Amber add a quote by John Milton
item.description: "The mind is its own place, and in itself can make a heaven of hell, a hell of heaven.." -- John Milton

item.title: Amber add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Amber add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Amber add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Amber add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Amber add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "There may be times when we are powerless to prevent injustice, but there must never be a time when we fail to protest." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Amber add a quote by Babe Ruth
item.description: "Every strike brings me closer to the next home run." -- Babe Ruth

item.title: Amber add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Cats are intended to teach us that not everything in nature has a purpose." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Amber add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description:
"The Road Not Taken
Two roads diverged in a yellow wood, And sorry I could not travel both And be one traveler, long I stood And looked down one as far as I could To where it bent in the undergrowth;
Then took the other, as just as fair, And having perhaps the better claim, Because it was grassy and wanted wear; Though as for that the passing there Had worn them really about the same,
And both that morning equally lay In leaves no step had trodden black. Oh, I kept the first for another day! Yet knowing how way leads on to way, I doubted if I should ever come back.
I shall be telling this with a sigh Somewhere ages and ages hence: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I— I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Amber add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "The best way out is always through." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Amber add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa
